decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and disrupting your opponent's game plan by taxing their resources. It also utilizes powerful removal spells and protection to maintain board control. It aims to apply pressure early on and force opponents to make suboptimal plays, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of efficient threats and disruption.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, supported by anthem effects from cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm to clear the way for attacks. Additionally, it uses synergies like Goblin Bombardment to deal additional damage and cards like Seasoned Pyromancer for card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient threats and close out the game quickly.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. With cards like Thoughtseize, Counterspell, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through draw spells like Cling to Dust and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Subtlety to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The mana base is tuned to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures to dominate the board. By constantly disrupting your opponent's plans and maintaining card advantage, you can slowly grind them down while building up your own resources. With powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Solitude, and Galvanic Discharge, you have the tools to outlast your opponent and secure victory through superior card advantage and strategic decision-making. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in your mana base.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and control elements to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding provide additional support to keep the pressure on the opponent while Teferi, Time Raveler offers flexibility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to win through a combination of aggressive creatures and control elements.

The key concept of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through a combination of powerful counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and outvalue them with efficient removal and powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. By utilizing cards like Ephemerate and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, this deck can generate incremental advantage over time and protect its key threats. With a mix of disruption, card draw, and powerful finishers, this Control deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan by using a combination of lockout cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Blood Moon, while also utilizing cards like Lantern of Insight and Codex Shredder to manipulate the opponent's draw and prevent them from accessing key cards. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts in this control-heavy Lantern Control archetype.

This deck focuses on quickly putting out artifact creatures and utilizing various artifacts to increase their power and efficiency. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive gameplay style, while also having some control elements with Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke. The deck utilizes the synergy between artifacts and creatures to create a potent threat on the battlefield, while also having ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Tormod's Crypt. The inclusion of Urza's Saga adds extra versatility and strength to the deck's strategy.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to play a fast and aggressive game, utilizing low-cost spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart, alongside efficient creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes card filtering and selection tools like Preordain and Expressive Iteration to ensure consistent draws and maintain pressure on the opponent. The mana base of fetch lands and shock lands allows for quick and consistent access to both colors of mana needed for the deck to operate effectively.

The deck focuses on playing multiple spells each turn to generate a significant amount of mana through cost reduction effects and card draw. By chaining together rituals and cantrips, the player aims to cast a high storm count spell like Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to their opponent. Ral, Monsoon Mage provides additional card advantage and damage potential, while Wish allows for flexibility in finding key combo pieces. The deck utilizes the Ruby Storm archetype to create explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with efficient and low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter. By combining cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth with prowess triggers from cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, the deck aims to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent. By utilizing cantrips like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration for card advantage, the deck maintains its aggression while staying versatile and adaptive to various board states. With a mix of burn spells and creature threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Living End combo to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield. The deck includes various cards that can help cycle through the deck, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and provide extra value when creatures enter the battlefield. By efficiently using resources and setting up the right sequence of plays, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mass of creatures all at once, ultimately securing victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts onto the battlefield to power up its synergies and abilities, while also disrupting the opponent with spells like Repeal and Unholy Heat. Emry and Tamiyo offer card advantage and recursion, while Urza's Saga provides additional threats and utility. By combining aggressive plays with disruptive elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game, utilizing the affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of its artifacts and gain a tempo advantage.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on consistently putting pressure on the opponent with quick creatures like Ragavan and Guide of Souls, while also utilizing cards like Ajani and Phlage for additional damage and control. The deck also includes versatile options like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm for removal and utility. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and maintain board presence throughout the game, with powerful finishers like Voice of Victory and static Prison to secure the win.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board with cheap and efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off, while utilizing instant-speed burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to remove threats and close out the game quickly. The deck also incorporates card draw and selection with cards like Expressive Iteration and Mishra's Bauble to maintain momentum and find key pieces. Additionally, the inclusion of Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge shows the focus on maximizing damage output and ensuring every spell and attack counts towards victory.

This deck focuses on quickly getting creatures onto the battlefield to put pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Galvanic Discharge, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while continuously applying pressure. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler providing additional disruption and protection, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.
